item.title: Apple gets deeper into China’s smartphone price wars with widening iPhone discounts, but rival Huawei stays above the fray
item.description:
English Summary:

  • Apple offered bigger discounts than usual on the iPhone 15 in China to compete with rival Android handsets.
  • Chinese e-commerce platform JD.com offered an 800 yuan discount on the iPhone 15, while Apple offered a 500 yuan discount on a range of older models.
  • The price war intensified as major Chinese smartphone vendors like Xiaomi and Honor also lowered prices of their Android models.
  • Huawei did not follow suit, suggesting a different strategy for its comeback in the 5G smartphone market.
  • Apple's focus in China comes amid sluggish global iPhone sales and two ratings downgrades.
  • Apple overtook Samsung as the top global smartphone vendor in 2023, but demand for iPhones fell 30% in China.

Chinese Summary:

  • 苹果在中国推出大幅降价促销活动，以应对安卓手机的竞争。
  • 中国电商平台京东在iPhone 15上给出800元优惠，苹果则在包括 iPhone 13 和去年 9 月发布的新款手机在内的多款机型上给出最高 500 元的优惠。
  • 随着小米、荣耀等国产手机厂商也纷纷降价促销，价格战加剧。
  • 华为并未跟进，暗示其在5G智能手机市场复出采取了不同的策略。
  • 苹果在中国放低身段促销与全球iPhone销量低迷以及遭遇两次评级下调有关。
  • 苹果2023年超越三星成为全球最大智能手机厂商，但中国市场的iPhone销量下降了30%。

Words:

  • unseat (v.) - /ˌʌnˈsiːt/ 击败，赶下台。

    原文例句：Apple topped global smartphone shipments in 2023 to unseat long-standing market leader Samsung, according to research firm IDC.

    例句讲解：这个词由un-（前缀，表示否定）和seat（座位，位置）组成，表示“击败，赶下台”。在这个例句中，它表示苹果公司在2023年超过了长期占据市场领先地位的三星公司，成为了全球智能手机市场的头号厂商。

  • discount (n.) - /ˈdɪskaʊnt/ 折扣，减价。

    原文例句：The latest iPhone markdowns have come as major Chinese smartphone vendors knocked down prices on their various Android handsets in both online and offline retail campaigns.

    例句讲解：这个词来源于古法语desconter（扣除），表示“折扣，减价”。在这个例句中，它指的是中国主要智能手机厂商在网上和线下的零售活动中降低了其不同型号的安卓手机的价格。

Phrases:

  • price war - 价格战。

    原文例句：A price war in mainland China, the world’s largest smartphone market, has intensified amid widening discounts offered for iPhones by online marketplaces, as Apple unseated rival Samsung Electronics in annual industry shipments worldwide for the first time in 2023.

    例句讲解：这个词组由price（价格）和war（战争）组成，表示“价格战”。在这个例句中，它指的是中国大陆作为全球最大的智能手机市场，在线上市场提供的iPhone折扣不断扩大，导致价格战加剧，而苹果公司在2023年首次在全球年度行业出货量中击败了竞争对手三星电子。

Sentences:

  • “Apple faced more challenges in China compared to the rest of the world,” said Will Wong, senior research manager for client devices at IDC Asia-Pacific. - 威尔·王，IDC 亚太区客户设备高级研究经理说道：“与世界其他地区相比，苹果在中国面临更多挑战。”

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是Apple faced more challenges in China，其中主语是Apple，谓语是faced，宾语是more challenges。compared to the rest of the world是一个介词短语作状语，修饰faced，表示与世界其他地区相比。said Will Wong, senior research manager for client devices at IDC Asia-Pacific是一个现在分词短语作状语，修饰faced，表示这句话是谁说的或谁的观点。这个句子的意思是说，IDC 亚太区客户设备高级研究经理威尔·王表示，与世界其他地区相比，苹果在中国面临更多挑战。

Grammar:

  • 倒装句 - 把本来应该在句首的句子成分放到了句尾。

    原文例句：On the intense global smartphone competition, the “overall Android space is diversifying within itself”, said Ryan Reith, group vice-president at IDC’s Worldwide Mobility and Consumer Device Trackers unit.

    语法讲解：倒装句是一种常见的修辞手法，目的是为了强调句子的某个成分或使句子更具文采。在这个例句中，On the intense global smartphone competition是一个介词短语，本来应该放在句首，但被放到了句尾，目的是为了强调激烈的全球智能手机竞争这一背景。这个句子的意思是说，IDC 全球移动和消费设备追踪器部门的集团副总裁瑞安·赖斯表示，在激烈的全球智能手机竞争中，“整个安卓领域正在内部实现多样化”。

  • Chinese e-commerce giant JD.com on Monday touted discounts of as much as US$112 off on the iPhone 15, higher than Apple’s own local price markdown
  • Apple topped global smartphone shipments in 2023 to unseat long-standing market leader Samsung, according to research firm IDC

A price war in mainland China, the world’s largest smartphone market, has intensified amid widening discounts offered for iPhones by online marketplaces, as Apple unseated rival Samsung Electronics in annual industry shipments worldwide for the first time in 2023.

Chinese e-commerce giant JD.com on Monday touted deeper discounts of as much as 800 yuan (US$112.24) off on the latest iPhone 15 model in a post on WeChat, which was on the same day Apple offered to cut prices by up to 500 yuan on a range of models, including the iPhone 13 and its new handsets that debuted last September.

The latest iPhone markdowns have come as major Chinese smartphone vendors, including Xiaomi and Honor, knocked down prices on their various Android models in both online and offline retail campaigns. Huawei Technologies, which last year made a comeback in the 5G smartphone market, did not pursue a similar strategy.

Apple’s atypical discount drive on the mainland shows the US tech giant’s focus to gain ground in the world’s second-biggest economy amid sluggish global iPhone sales, which has seen the company hit by two ratings downgrades in the first week of this year.

“Apple faced more challenges in China compared to the rest of the world,” said Will Wong, senior research manager for client devices at IDC Asia-Pacific. “It not only faced competition from Huawei, but also a change in consumers’ sentiment that is now more cautious in spending.”

In the first week of the year, iPhone sales on the mainland were already down 30 per cent year on year, according to a Jefferies research note published on January 7. The brokerage indicated that there was “a big rise in discounts” for the iPhone 14 and 14 Plus models, while the newer iPhone 15 and 15 Plus models saw “a moderate rise” in discounts.

The iPhone’s total sales volume last year on the mainland was down 3 per cent from 2022, which translated to a 0.4 per cent decline in Apple’s market share, according to Jefferies.

Worries about smartphone demand have pushed Apple’s shares down this month, enabling Microsoft to become the world’s most valuable company after ending the January 12 trading session in the US higher than the iPhone maker.

Microsoft overtakes Apple as world’s most valuable company at US$2.89 trillion

Still, Apple received some good news on Monday when research firm IDC reported that the Cupertino, California-based company topped global smartphone shipments last year to dethrone long-standing market leader Samsung.

Apple’s global smartphone shipments last year reached 234.6 million units that gave the company a record market share of 20.1 per cent, up 3.7 per cent from 226.3 million in 2022, according to IDC. Apple was also the sole smartphone vendor in the top-four rankings – including Samsung, Xiaomi and Oppo – to record unit shipment growth in 2023.

On the intense global smartphone competition, the “overall Android space is diversifying within itself”, said Ryan Reith, group vice-president at IDC’s Worldwide Mobility and Consumer Device Trackers unit. “Huawei is back and making inroads quickly within China.”

Shenzhen-based Huawei’s return to the premium segment of the smartphone market was paved by its launch last August of the Mate 60 Pro 5G handset, powered by an advanced home-grown processor that defied US tech restrictions. The company’s new 5G smartphone and its advanced chip was hailed as symbolic of China’s victory in defying tough US sanctions, fanning strong patriotic fervour that translated into robust domestic sales.

Huawei’s Mate 60 Pro is a blow to US sanctions but battles remain, analysts say

Huawei, however, faces a supply shortage for the Mate 60 Pro because of production constraints. The popular 5G model is still subject to a reservation purchase scheme without immediate availability on the company’s official website.

As Apple and its Chinese rivals turn to price promotions amid the weak macroeconomic environment on the mainland, Huawei will need to rely on the strength of its brand name to weather these headwinds, according to IDC’s Wong.

“The production constraints seem like a hurdle to Huawei, but it may also be a marketing tactic [to create greater demand],” Wong said.

item.title: HashKey claims ‘unicorn status’ after raising US$100 million for one of Hong Kong’s two licensed cryptocurrency exchanges
item.description:
Summary：

  • Hong Kong-based cryptocurrency exchange HashKey raised pre-money valuation of $1.2 billion in Series A funding round.
  • OKX Ventures led the funding round, aiming to solidify web3 ecosystem, diversify product offerings, and expand globally.

总结：

  • 香港加密货币交易所HashKey在A轮融资中筹集了12亿美元的估值。
  • OKX Ventures领投此轮融资，旨在稳固web3生态系统，使产品多样化并拓展全球业务。

单词：

  • unicorn company (n.) - 估值超过10亿美元的未上市科技公司。

    原文例句：HashKey Group, the company behind one of Hong Kong’s two cryptocurrency exchanges approved to serve retail investors, said it raised nearly US$100 million in a funding round that valued it at more than US$1 billion, making it a so-called unicorn company.

    例句讲解：这个单词由unicorn（独角兽）和company（公司）组合而成，字面意思是“独角兽公司”，用于比喻那些估值超过10亿美元的未上市科技公司。这种类型的公司通常快速增长，并拥有较高的市场潜力。

  • pre-money valuation (n.) - 公司募集资金前的估值。

    原文例句：Existing and new investors took part in its new Series A round, giving HashKey a pre-money valuation of US$1.2 billion, the Hong Kong-based company said in a statement on Tuesday, without disclosing any names.

    例句讲解：这个单词是由pre-（之前）,money（钱）,valuation（估值）三部分组成，表示“公司募集资金前的估值”。在投资过程中，对于一家公司在进行融资前所做的估值，称为pre-money valuation。这通常是在风险投资或私募股权融资中使用，以确定公司在进行融资前的价值。

词组：

  • take part in - 参加，参与。

    原文例句：Existing and new investors took part in its new Series A round, giving HashKey a pre-money valuation of US$1.2 billion, HashKey Group said.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由take（采取）和part（部分）组成，表示“参加，参与”。在这个例句中，它表示现有的和新的投资者参加了它的新A轮融资，使HashKey的估值达到了12亿美元。

句子：

  • OKX Ventures is one of the lead investors in HashKey’s funding round, Bloomberg reportedOKX Ventures是HashKey融资轮的领投方之一，彭博社报道。

    • 句子分析：这是一个主谓句，主语是OKX Ventures，谓语是is one of the lead investors in HashKey’s funding round。is one of the lead investors in HashKey’s funding round是一个现在时态的主谓结构，表示OKX Ventures是HashKey融资轮的领投方之一。Bloomberg reported是一个过去时态的句子，表示彭博社报道了这一消息。这个句子的意思是说，彭博社报道，OKX Ventures是HashKey融资轮的领投方之一。

语法：

  • 虚拟语气（Subjunctive Mood）- 表示虚拟、假设或不真实的情况。

    原文例句：That is a trickle compared with the US$13.6 billion transacted over the same period on Binance, the world’s largest exchange for cryptocurrencies.

    语法讲解：虚拟语气是一种表示虚拟、假设或不真实情况的语态。在英语中，虚拟语气通常使用过去时或过去完成时，有时也使用现在进行时或现在完成进行时。在这个例句中，That is a trickle compared with the US$13.6 billion transacted over the same period on Binance, the world’s largest exchange for cryptocurrencies.这句话使用了过去时，表示与世界上最大的加密货币交易所币安在同一时期交易的136亿美元相比，这只是一小部分。这里的过去时态表示一种虚拟或假设的情况，即如果与币安在同一时期交易的136亿美元相比，HashKey交易的1530万美元只是一小部分。

  • Existing and new investors took part in its new Series A round, giving HashKey a pre-money valuation of US$1.2 billion, HashKey Group said
  • OKX Ventures is one of the lead investors in HashKey’s funding round, Bloomberg reported

HashKey Group, the company behind one of Hong Kong’s two cryptocurrency exchanges approved to serve retail investors, said it raised nearly US$100 million in a funding round that valued it at more than US$1 billion, making it a so-called unicorn company.

Existing and new investors took part in its new Series A round, giving HashKey a pre-money valuation of US$1.2 billion, the Hong Kong-based company said in a statement on Tuesday, without disclosing any names.

OKX Ventures, the investment arm of OKX, one of the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchanges and an applicant for Hong Kong’s virtual asset exchange license, is one of the lead investors in HashKey’s funding round, Bloomberg reported. HashKey and OKX both declined to comment.

HashKey operates the licensed HashKey Exchange, the HashKey Capital venture capital and asset management arm and other blockchain technology services. It will use the funding to “solidify” its web3 ecosystem, diversify its licensed product offerings in Hong Kong and develop its business globally, it said.

China’s back-door cryptocurrency traders look more important than ever to Binance’s future

HashKey Group, established in Hong Kong in 2018, was approved by the Securities and Futures Commission last August to serve retail investors under the city’s new regime for centralised cryptocurrency exchanges.

The exchange attracted 15,500 registered users at the end of 2023, with daily trading volume exceeding US$630 million in December, HashKey said last month. Nearly 40 per cent of the value traded on its platform came from professional investors, it said.

What does Hong Kong mean by virtual assets?

HashKey Exchange handled US$15.3 million in trading volume over 24 hours through Tuesday, according to the market tracker CoinGecko. That is a trickle compared with the US$13.6 billion transacted over the same period on Binance, the world’s largest exchange for cryptocurrencies.

HashKey is one of a range of cryptocurrency firms banking on Hong Kong’s push to embrace the virtual asset industry, even as public perception of the sector has plunged following scandals involving companies including FTX and JPEX.

Twelve companies have so far submitted their applications for Hong Kong’s licence for virtual asset trading platforms.

High costs cloud Hong Kong’s crypto hub dream

Venture capital funding in the cryptocurrency industry plunged last year following a series of collapses in 2022. In the three months ending September 2023, cryptocurrency firms around the world raised US$1.8 billion across 309 deals, representing a 69.6 per cent decline in deal value and 55.9 per cent drop in deal numbers from the same period a year ago, according to data by PitchBook.

The market recently bounced back on the back of enthusiasm brought by the US’ approval of the first spot bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs), which allow investors to gain exposure to virtual assets without directly buying any cryptocurrency tokens.

Hong Kong last month also said that it will move to open up retail access to cryptocurrency spot ETFs, after previously only allowing retail participation in cryptocurrency futures ETFs, which hold cryptocurrency futures contracts, instead of direct investments in cryptocurrency tokens at their spot prices.

item.title: Tech war: Chinese chip-tool giant Naura forecasts surge in 2023 sales on strong local demand amid US export controls
item.description:
English Summary：

Chinese leading semiconductor equipment manufacturer, Naura Technology Group, predicts a notable increase in both revenue and net profit for 2023. This upsurge is attributed to technological advancements that have strengthened the company's domestic market share. Naura reported a revenue growth projection between 42% and 57%, reaching approximately 20.9 billion yuan to 23.1 billion yuan. This translates to $2.93 billion to $3.24 billion. Furthermore, net profits are anticipated to soar by 57% to 80%, ranging from 3.3 billion yuan to 3.8 billion yuan. Moreover, Naura secured 30 billion yuan worth of new equipment orders last year, primarily in the semiconductor sector. The company's success is a reflection of China's efforts to achieve self-sufficiency in semiconductor production, driven by the departure of foreign equipment suppliers from the country.
  • Abstract: Chinese semiconductor equipment company, Naura, anticipates a substantial growth in revenue and net profit for 2023 due to technological breakthroughs and domestic market expansion.
  • Theme: Naura's technological advancements propel revenue and profit growth, capturing a larger market share and benefiting from China's push for semiconductor self-sufficiency.
  • Viewpoint: Naura's success highlights the resilience and growth potential of domestic semiconductor companies in the face of international competition and trade restrictions.
  • Main information: Naura's projected revenue and profit increase; focus on volume production of semiconductor equipment; securing new equipment orders; China's government-supported semiconductor self-sufficiency drive.

Chinese Summary：

国内半导体设备龙头企业纳芯科技集团预计2023年营收和净利润将大幅提升，这主要得益于公司技术上的突破，使其在国内市场份额提升。纳芯表示，去年营收预计增长42%至57%，达到209亿至231亿元人民币（29.3亿美元至32.4亿美元）。公司预计净利润将增长57%至80%，达到33亿至38亿元人民币。2023年，公司收到超过300亿元新设备订单，其中超过70%与半导体相关。在政府支持的半导体自给自足战略背景下，纳芯的大客户长江存储正在与国内设备供应商洽谈，包括一家总部位于北京的大型公司，以生产替代美国公司Lam Research生产的关键设备中的部件。由于美国加强了出口管制，Lam Research已暂停向中国大陆客户供应设备和服务。随着外国供应商撤离中国，国内芯片制造商纷纷寻找本土替代品，这提振了中国设备制造商的销售，但大多数产品，尤其是10纳米以下先进制程的产品，质量仍落后。纳芯的主要竞争对手，北方华创，表示预计2023年收入将增长30%以上，受到来自中国大陆代工厂的强劲需求带动。纳芯在深圳上市的股票周二早盘上涨约3%，至近239元人民币。
  • 摘要：中国半导体设备龙头企业纳芯科技预计2023年营收和净利大幅增长，得益于技术突破和国内市场份额提升。
  • 主题： 纳芯科技的技术突破推动收入和利润增长，抢占更大市场份额，并受益于中国半导体自给自足的政策方向。
  • 观点： 纳芯科技的成功突显了本土半导体企业面对国际竞争和贸易限制时的韧性和增长潜力。
  • 主要信息： 纳芯科技预计营收和利润增长；注重半导体设备批量生产；获得新设备订单；中国政府支持半导体自给自足的战略。

单词：

  • foundry (n.) - /ˈfaʊndriː/ 铸造厂，铸造车间。

    原文例句：Beijing-based Naura counts China’s largest foundries as major clients, such as Yangtze Memory Technologies Corp (YMTC). - 纳芯将中国最大的铸造厂视作主要客户，例如长江存储。

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于古法语fendre（熔化），表示“铸造厂，铸造车间”。在这个例句中，它指的是中国最大的铸造厂，例如长江存储。

  • self-sufficiency (n.) - /ˌsɛlf səˈfɪʃənsi/ 自给自足。

    原文例句：Amid a government-supported semiconductor self-sufficiency drive, YMTC has been in talks with domestic tool suppliers, including what was said to be a major company based in the Chinese capital, to produce replacements for crucial parts widely found in its equipment made by US firm Lam Research. - 在政府支持半导体自给自足的努力下，长江存储一直在与国内工具供应商谈判，包括一家总部位于中国首都的大公司，以生产替换美国公司Lam Research制造的设备中广泛使用的关键部件。

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于self（自己）和sufficiency（足够），表示“自给自足”。在这个例句中，它指的是政府支持半导体自给自足的努力。

  • leaps and bounds (idiom) - 进步神速，迅速发展。

    原文例句：With foreign players pulling their staff and operations out of China, local chip makers have rushed to find domestic alternatives. The surging demand has helped lift sales of Chinese equipment manufacturers, although most of their products – especially those in advanced nodes below 10 nanometers – are thought to lag in quality. - 随着外国参与者撤出他们在中国的员工和运营，当地芯片制造商纷纷寻找国内替代品。激增的需求帮助提升了中国设备制造商的销售额，尽管他们的大多数产品（尤其是那些低于10纳米的先进节点的产品）在质量上被认为有差距。

    例句讲解：这个习语来源于leap（跳跃）和bound（界限），表示“进步神速，迅速发展”。在这个例句中，它指的是中国设备制造商的销售额迅速增长。

词组：

  • rush to do sth. - 匆忙做某事。

    原文例句：With foreign players pulling their staff and operations out of China, local chip makers have rushed to find domestic alternatives. - 随着外国参与者撤出他们在中国的员工和运营，当地芯片制造商纷纷寻找国内替代品。

    例句讲解：这个短语由rush（赶忙）和to do sth.（做某事）组成，表示“匆忙做某事”。在这个例句中，它指的是当地芯片制造商匆忙寻找国内替代品。

  • secure an order - 确保订单。

    原文例句：The company said it received over 30 billion yuan worth of new equipment orders in 2023, over 70 per cent of them related to semiconductor-related tools. -该公司表示，2023年获得超过300亿元人民币的新设备订单，其中超过70%与半导体相关。

    例句讲解：这个短语由secure（确保）和an order（一个订单）组成，表示“确保订单”。在这个例句中，它指的是该公司获得超过300亿元人民币的新设备订单。

句子：

  • The company said in a regulatory filing on Monday evening that its revenue last year is projected to grow between 42 per cent and 57 per cent to 20.9 billion yuan and 23.1 billion yuan. - 公司在周一晚上的监管文件中表示，预计去年营收将增长42%至57%，达到209亿至231亿元人民币。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是revenue is projected to grow，其中主语是revenue，谓语是is projected to grow，宾语是between 42 per cent and 57 per cent to 20.9 billion yuan and 23.1 billion yuan。The company said in a regulatory filing on Monday evening是一个过去分词短语作状语，表示这一消息是在周一晚上的监管文件中公布的。这个句子的意思是说，该公司在周一晚上的监管文件中表示，预计去年营收将增长42%至57%，达到209亿至231亿元人民币。

语法：

  • Naura Technology expects a jump in both its revenue and net profit in 2023, as technology breakthroughs drive local demand
  • With foreign semiconductor equipment manufacturers pulling out of China, local chip makers have rushed to find domestic alternatives

State-backed Chinese semiconductor equipment giant Naura Technology Group expects its 2023 revenue to jump by around half from a year earlier, as leaps in its technology helped it gain a larger market share in the country.

The company said in a regulatory filing on Monday evening that its revenue last year is projected to grow between 42 per cent and 57 per cent to 20.9 billion yuan and 23.1 billion yuan (US$2.93 billion and US$3.24 billion).

“[Naura] has made technology breakthroughs and achieved volume production of more than a dozen of semiconductor equipment including etching, deposition and cleaning, and furnace, which help the company to cover more semiconductor manufacturing processes, leading to higher market shares,” Naura said.

Net profits are expected to increase between 57 per cent and 80 per cent to between 3.3 billion yuan and 3.8 billion yuan.

The company said it received over 30 billion yuan worth of new equipment orders in 2023, over 70 per cent of them related to semiconductor-related tools. It did not disclose similar figures in its revenue forecasts for 2022 or 2021.

Beijing-based Naura counts China’s largest foundries as major clients, such as Yangtze Memory Technologies Corp (YMTC).

Amid a government-supported semiconductor self-sufficiency drive, YMTC has been in talks with domestic tool suppliers, including what was said to be a major company based in the Chinese capital, to produce replacements for crucial parts widely found in its equipment made by US firm Lam Research, sources told the Post last year.

Lam Research has suspended equipment supply and services to clients in mainland China after Washington tightened US export controls in October 2022.

With foreign players pulling their staff and operations out of China, local chip makers have rushed to find domestic alternatives. The surging demand has helped lift sales of Chinese equipment manufacturers, although most of their products – especially those in advanced nodes below 10 nanometres – are thought to lag in quality.

Advanced Micro-Fabrication Equipment China, Naura’s main rival, has said it expects 2023 revenue to rise more than 30 per cent on the back of strong demand from mainland fabs.

Shares of Shenzhen-listed Naura rose around 3 per cent to nearly 239 yuan in the morning trading session on Tuesday.

item.title: Microsoft launches consumer version of Copilot for US$20 a month with access to ChatGPT technology through Office
item.description:
Summary：

Microsoft has launched a consumer version of its Copilot artificial intelligence tool and made the corporate version available to smaller companies. The consumer version, called Copilot Pro, costs US$20 per month and offers access to OpenAI's latest ChatGPT technology and image-creation features. It can be used to answer questions, summarize data, and create content in Microsoft Office applications such as Word, Outlook, Excel, and PowerPoint. Microsoft has also eliminated the 300-subscription minimum requirement for its enterprise service, making it more accessible to small businesses.
  • Abstract: Microsoft debuts consumer version of Copilot AI tool and expands corporate version to smaller companies.
  • Theme: Microsoft's efforts to increase paying customers for its new AI services.
  • Viewpoint: The growing demand for AI assistance in the commercial space and Microsoft's strategy to capitalize on it.
  • Main information: Features and pricing of Copilot Pro; elimination of 300-subscription minimum for enterprise service; plans to roll out a builder tool for creating custom Copilots.

总结：

微软公司推出其 Copilot 人工智能工具的消费者版本，并将企业版本开放给小型公司。这个消费者版本名为 Copilot Pro，每月收费 20 美元，提供了对 OpenAI 最新的 ChatGPT 技术和图像创建功能的访问权限。它可以用于回答问题、总结数据并在 Microsoft Office 应用程序（如 Word、Outlook、Excel 和 PowerPoint）中创建内容。微软还取消了其企业服务的 300 项订阅最低要求，使其更易于小型企业访问。
  • 摘要：微软首次亮相 Copilot AI 工具的消费者版本，并将企业版本扩展到较小的公司。
  • 主题：微软努力增加其新的人工智能服务的用户。
  • 观点：商业领域对人工智能的帮助需求不断增长，而微软利用它获利的策略。
  • 主要信息：Copilot Pro 的功能和定价；取消企业服务的 300 个订阅最低要求；计划推出建立自定义 Copilot 的工具。

单词：

  • unveiled (v.) - /ʌnˈveɪld/ 揭幕，公布。

    原文例句：The company, which has been selling a similar product to large businesses for a monthly fee of US$30 per user, will get rid of the 300-subscription minimum for its enterprise service.

    例句讲解：“unveil”意为“揭幕，公布”，常用作及物动词，可以与名词或动名词连用。在这个例句中，“unveiled”与名词“300-subscription minimum”连用，表示微软公司将取消企业服务的 300 个订阅最低要求。

  • roll out (v.) - /rəʊl aʊt/ 推出，发布。

    原文例句：Microsoft plans to roll out a builder tool, similar to what OpenAI unveiled last year, that will let individuals create their own Copilots for a specific topic, a service that is already available to enterprises.

    例句讲解：“roll out”意为“推出，发布”，常用作及物动词，可以与名词或动名词连用。在这个例句中，“roll out”与名词“builder tool”连用，表示微软计划推出一个类似于 OpenAI 去年发布的构建工具，允许个人为特定主题创建自己的 Copilot。

  • differentiate (v.) - /dɪˈfɜːrɛnʃɪeɪt/ 区分，使不同。

    原文例句：Microsoft’s consumer service, called Copilot Pro, offers similar features to OpenAI’s ChatGPT Plus at the same price, though the integration with Office differentiates their product, Spataro said.

    例句讲解：“differentiate”意为“区分，使不同”，常用作及物动词，可以与名词或动名词连用。在这个例句中，“differentiate”与名词“integration with Office”连用，表示微软的消费者服务 Copilot Pro 与 OpenAI 的 ChatGPT Plus 具有类似的功能，但与 Office 的集成使他们的产品与众不同。

词组：

  • artificial intelligence tool - 人工智能工具。

    原文例句：Microsoft is opening up its artificial intelligence assistant to consumers and making the corporate version available to smaller companies as it tries to increase the number of paying customers for the new services.

    例句讲解：“artificial intelligence tool”意为“人工智能工具”，是指利用人工智能技术开发的软件或系统，可以帮助人类完成各种任务。在这个例句中，“artificial intelligence tool”指的是微软公司推出的 Copilot 人工智能工具。

  • cloud subscription - 云订阅。

    原文例句：Consumers with a cloud subscription to Office will be able to use Copilot to help answer questions, summarise data and create content in Word, Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint.

    例句讲解：“cloud subscription”意为“云订阅”，是指用户按月或按年向云服务提供商支付费用，以使用其云计算服务。在这个例句中，“cloud subscription”指的是用户对 Microsoft Office 的云订阅。

句子：

  • Microsoft has been testing the Office-based copilot, now called Copilot for Microsoft 365, since March. - 微软自 3 月以来一直在测试这个基于 Office 的副驾驶，现在称为 Microsoft 365 的副驾。

    • 句子分析：“Microsoft has been testing the Office-based copilot, now called Copilot for Microsoft 365, since March.”是一个复合句，包括一个主句和一个从句。主句是“Microsoft has been testing the Office-based copilot”，其中“Microsoft”是主语，“has been testing”是谓语，“the Office-based copilot”是宾语。从句是“now called Copilot for Microsoft 365”，其中“now called Copilot for Microsoft 365”是对“the Office-based copilot”的修饰。

  • The company plans to roll out a builder tool, similar to what OpenAI unveiled last year, that will let individuals create their own Copilots for a specific topic, a service that is already available to enterprises. - 该公司计划推出一个构建器工具，类似于 OpenAI 去年推出的工具，它将允许个人为特定主题创建自己的 Copilot，这项服务目前已向企业开放。

    • 句子分析：“The company plans to roll out a builder tool, similar to what OpenAI unveiled last year, that will let individuals create their own Copilots for a specific topic, a service that is already available to enterprises.”是一个复杂句，包括一个主句和两个从句。主句是“The company plans to roll out a builder tool”，其中“The company”是主语，“plans to roll out”是谓语，“a builder tool”是宾语。第一个从句是“similar to what OpenAI unveiled last year”，其中“similar to what OpenAI unveiled last year”是对“a builder tool”的修饰。第二个从句是“that will let individuals create their own Copilots for a specific topic, a service that is already available to enterprises”，其中“that will let individuals create their own Copilots for a specific topic”是对“a builder tool”的进一步解释，“a service that is already available to enterprises”是对“a builder tool”的补充说明。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Microsoft has been testing the Office-based copilot, now called Copilot for Microsoft 365, since March. - 微软自 3 月以来一直在测试这个基于 Office 的副驾驶，现在称为 Microsoft 365 的副驾。

    语法讲解：现在完成时由“have/has + been + 现在分词”构成，表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。在这个例句中，“has been testing”表示微软公司自 3 月以来一直都在测试 Copilot。

  • 虚拟语气 - 表示说话人不确定或假设的情况。

    原文例句：

    • Consumers of Office will be able to use Copilot Pro to help answer questions and create content in Word, Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint
    • Companies previously had to buy at least 300 subscriptions to use Copilot, a requirement Microsoft is getting rid of

    Microsoft is opening up its artificial intelligence assistant to consumers and making the corporate version available to smaller companies as it tries to increase the number of paying customers for the new services.

    Microsoft is selling a US$20-a-month consumer version of Copilot, with access to OpenAI’s latest ChatGPT technology and image-creation features, the Redmond, Washington-based software giant said in a statement.

    Consumers with a cloud subscription to Office will be able to use Copilot to help answer questions, summarise data and create content in Word, Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint.

    The company, which has been selling a similar product to large businesses for a monthly fee of US$30 per user, will get rid of the 300-subscription minimum for its enterprise service.

    As Microsoft has revamped nearly all of its products around artificial intelligence tools based on technology from OpenAI, its Office products remain one of the best ways to get customers to pay extra for AI assistance.

    Executives have said demand is unusually high, with Azure chief Scott Guthrie likening it to the queues outside shops to purchase Windows 95 software nearly three decades ago.

    Microsoft has been testing the Office-based copilot, now called Copilot for Microsoft 365, since March. The company began selling it widely in November, as long as companies purchased at least 300 subscriptions. That left out small businesses and those that wanted to begin with a smaller trial, said Jared Spataro, a Microsoft vice-president, in an interview.

    “We have just never seen demand in the commercial space for a product like we are seeing for Copilot from Microsoft 365,’’ he said. “We have had pressure I have never seen from small and medium businesses saying ‘why will you not let us buy this? Let us try it’.”

    Microsoft announced the new services ahead of the World Economic Forum in Davos, which will be attended by chief executive officer Satya Nadella.

    Microsoft’s consumer service, called Copilot Pro, offers similar features to OpenAI’s ChatGPT Plus at the same price, though the integration with Office differentiates their product, Spataro said.

    The company plans to roll out a builder tool, similar to what OpenAI unveiled last year, that will let individuals create their own Copilots for a specific topic, a service that is already available to enterprises.

    Microsoft’s privacy rules for the consumer version also differ from the business one. Unlike data from corporate customers, Microsoft said it will retain a portion of prompts and responses from the consumer model to retrain models and improve the product.

item.title: AirPods maker Goertek to open Vietnam factory as part of Apple’s supply chain diversification
item.description:
Summary：

Apple supplier Goertek plans to invest US$280 million to establish a wholly-owned subsidiary in Vietnam to meet demands for "business expansion and long-term operation." The subsidiary will manufacture consumer electronics products, including AirPods, smartwatches, VR, and AR gear. The move comes as Apple is shifting more production outside China and encouraging its contract manufacturing partners to diversify into other countries.
  • Abstract: Apple supplier Goertek invests in Vietnam to expand production.
  • Theme: Apple's shift in production strategy and its impact on suppliers.
  • Viewpoint: The importance of diversification in supply chains and the role of Vietnam in Apple's production network.
  • Main information: Goertek's investment in Vietnam; the types of products to be manufactured; Apple's encouragement of suppliers to diversify production.

总结：

苹果供应商歌尔股份计划投资2.8亿美元在越南建立一家独资子公司，以满足“业务扩张和长期运营”的需求。这家子公司将生产消费电子产品，包括AirPods、智能手表、虚拟现实和增强现实设备。此举正值苹果将更多生产转移出中国之际，苹果鼓励其代工合作伙伴将其生产线多元化到其他国家。
  • 摘要：苹果供应商歌尔股份投资越南以扩大生产。
  • 主题：苹果生产策略的转变及其对供应商的影响。
  • 观点：供应链多元化重要性以及越南在苹果生产网络中的作用。
  • 主要信息：歌尔股份对越南的投资；要生产的产品类型；苹果鼓励供应商多元化生产。

单词：

  • subsidiary (n.) - /səbˈsɪdɪəri/ 子公司。

    原文例句：The Vietnamese subsidiary is expected to be located in the Bac Ninh province, which has attracted investment from a raft of South Korean firms.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Latin，由sub-（在……之下）和sidere（坐，落）组成，意为“坐落于某物之下，从属的，辅助的”。在这个例句中，它指的是越南子公司，即歌尔股份在越南设立的全资子公司。

  • diversify (v.) - /dɪˈvɜːsɪfaɪ/ 多样化，使多样化。

    原文例句：Since then, Apple has encouraged its contract manufacturing partners to diversify into other countries, including Vietnam, to reduce its reliance on China.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Latin，由di-（分开）和versus（转向）组成，意为“使变化，使多样化”。在这个例句中，它描述了自那时以来，苹果鼓励其代工合作伙伴将生产线多样化到包括越南在内的其他国家，以减少对中国的依赖。

词组：

  • set up - 建立，设立。

    原文例句：The Vietnamese subsidiary, which will be set up through its Hong Kong entity Goertek (Hong Kong) Co, is expected to be located in northern Bac Ninh province.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由set（放置，设置）和up（向上，起来）组成，意为“建立，设立”。在这个例句中，它表示越南子公司将通过其香港实体歌尔（香港）有限公司设立，并预计位于北部的北宁省。

句子：

  • Apple supplier Goertek said on Monday it would invest up to US$280 million to establish a wholly-owned subsidiary in Vietnam to meet demands for “business expansion and long-term operation” in the Southeast Asian nation, according to a corporate filing. - 苹果供应商歌尔股份周一表示，将投资高达2.8亿美元在越南建立一家独资子公司，以满足东南亚国家“业务扩张和长期运营”的需求，据公司文件显示。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是Goertek said it would invest up to US$280 million to establish a wholly-owned subsidiary in Vietnam，其中主语是Goertek，谓语是said，宾语是it would invest up to US$280 million to establish a wholly-owned subsidiary in Vietnam。on Monday是一个时间状语，表示周一。to meet demands for “business expansion and long-term operation” in the Southeast Asian nation是一个目的状语，表示为了满足东南亚国家“业务扩张和长期运营”的需求。according to a corporate filing是一个状语，表示根据公司文件显示。这个句子的意思是说，苹果供应商歌尔股份周一表示，将投资高达2.8亿美元在越南建立一家独资子公司，以满足东南亚国家“业务扩张和长期运营”的需求，据公司文件显示。

语法：

  • 现在进行时 - 表示正在进行的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Goertek is starting to shift more of its production outside China.

    语法讲解：这是一个时态，结构是：am/is/are + 现在分词。其中am/is/are要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，现在分词是动词的-ing形式。这种时态表示动作或状态正在进行，强调动作或状态的进行性。在这个例句中，it表示歌尔股份正在将更多生产转移出中国。

  • 被动语态 - 表示动作或状态是由句子中的宾语承受的。

    原文例句：The Vietnamese subsidiary is expected to be located in the Bac Ninh province.

    语法讲解：这是一个语态，结构是：be + 过去分词。其中be要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，过去分词是动词的-ed或-en形式。这种语态表示动作或状态是由句子中的宾语承受的，强调动作或状态的承受者。在这个例句中，it表示越南子公司预计将位于北宁省。

  • Goertek was tapped by Apple as one of the major mainland suppliers of its mixed-reality Vision Pro headset, which is set to launch in early February
  • The Vietnamese subsidiary is expected to be located in the Bac Ninh province, which has attracted investment from a raft of South Korean firms

Apple supplier Goertek said on Monday it would invest up to US$280 million to establish a wholly-owned subsidiary in Vietnam to meet demands for “business expansion and long-term operation” in the Southeast Asian nation, according to a corporate filing.

Goertek’s Vietnamese entity, which will manufacture consumer electronics products, from AirPods and smartwatches to virtual reality and augmented reality gear, is a project that will meet both the Chinese assembler’s future development plan and client demand, it said in the filing to the Shenzhen Stock Exchange.

“[The project] is advantageous to make better use of local resources in Vietnam to enhance the company’s overall competitiveness,” Goertek said.

The company has been tapped by Apple to become one of the major mainland suppliers of its mixed-reality Vision Pro headset, which is set to launch in early February.

Apple supplier BOE signs US$9 billion deal to build display plant in China

The Vietnamese subsidiary, which will be set up through its Hong Kong entity Goertek (Hong Kong) Co, is expected to be located in northern Bac Ninh province, which has attracted investment from a raft of South Korean firms including consumer electronics and semiconductor giant Samsung Electronics.

South Korean firms have emerged as major investors in that province, setting up factories for electronics, smartphones, semiconductors and precision mechanical manufacturing equipment, according to the Vietnam Chamber of Commerce and Industry.

Goertek’s latest move comes as Apple is starting to shift more of its production outside China, a move that came after Beijing’s stringent Covid-19 restrictions during the pandemic disrupted the US firm's manufacturing supply chain, impacting its global sales in the lead up to the Christmas shopping season in 2022.

JD.com supports Huawei’s HarmonyOS as alternative for Apple iOS, Android in China

Since then, Apple has encouraged its contract manufacturing partners to diversify into other countries, including Vietnam, to reduce its reliance on China.

Apple suppliers, including Taiwanese electronics contract manufacturer Foxconn Technology Group, have invested up to US$16 billion to reduce their dependence on China, by relocating facilities to India, Vietnam, Mexico as well as the US, according to a report by AppleInsider, citing research by investment bank TD Cowen.

Foxconn, formally known as Hon Hai Precision Industry and the world's biggest maker of iPhones, late last year announced a plan to invest US$1.6 billion in India to expand its presence in the South Asian nation.

item.title: Apple’s China price cuts on iPhones, MacBooks ‘cancel out’ pressure from rivals chasing premium segment, analysts say
item.description:
Summary：

Facing competitive pressure from Chinese brands like Huawei, Apple China offers discounts of up to 800 yuan on iPhones, iPads, MacBooks, and other products to boost sales ahead of the Lunar New Year. The promotion aims to clear older models and counter the surge in consumer spending during the festival. Apple has been facing challenges from Chinese rivals in the premium smartphone segment, with Huawei making significant gains in the market.
  • Abstract: Apple China unveils Lunar New Year discounts to bolster sales amidst rising competition.
  • Theme: Apple China provides substantial discounts on various products to counter competitive pressure and enhance sales.
  • Viewpoint: Apple's strategic move to attract customers during the Lunar New Year shopping season.
  • Main information: Range of products with discounts, timing coinciding with Lunar New Year, addressing competition from local brands.

总结：

面对来自华为等中国品牌的竞争压力，中国苹果公司提供最高可达 800 元的折扣，适用于 iPhone、iPad、MacBook 等产品，以在农历新年之前提振销售额。此促销活动旨在清理旧款产品，并应对节日期间消费者支出的大幅增加。苹果一直在面临来自中国竞争对手的挑战，特别是在高端智能手机领域，华为在该市场取得了重大进展。
  • 摘要：中国苹果公司推出农历新年折扣，以在竞争日益激烈的环境中提振销售额。
  • 主题：中国苹果公司通过在各种产品上提供大幅折扣来应对竞争压力并提高销售额。
  • 观点：苹果公司在农历新年购物季吸引顾客的战略举措。
  • 主要信息：提供折扣的产品系列，与农历新年时段相吻合的时间安排，应对本地品牌的竞争。

单词：

  • counter (v.) - /ˈkaʊntər/ 对抗，反驳。

    原文例句：In a move to fend off intensifying competition from local rivals such as Huawei Technologies ahead of the Lunar New Year.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于拉丁语contra，表示“面向、反对”。在这个例句中，它指的是在中国春节前夕，为了抵御来自华为等本土对手日益激烈的竞争，苹果公司做出了应对措施。

  • annual (adj.) - /ˈænjuəl/ 一年的，每年的。

    原文例句：The sale, coming several weeks ahead of the Lunar New Year, the most important annual festival for Chinese people, is expected to boost revenue for Apple amid increasing competition from local players,

    例句讲解：这个单词是由拉丁语annus（一年）构成的，表示“一年的，每年的”。在这个例句中，它指的是一年中最重要传统节日——农历新年。农历新年在农历中被称为春节，寓意新的一年的开始，是人们祭祀祖先和神灵的节日。

词组：

  • in a move to - 为了，试图。

    原文例句：In a move to fend off intensifying competition from local rivals such as Huawei Technologies ahead of the Lunar New Year.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由in（在，向），a（一个），move（动作，举动），to（向，为了）构成的，表示“为了，试图”。在这个例句中，它表示在中国春节前夕，为了抵御来自华为等本土对手日益激烈的竞争，苹果公司做出了应对措施。

句子：

  • The sale, coming several weeks ahead of the Lunar New Year, the most important annual festival for Chinese people, is expected to boost revenue for Apple amid increasing competition from local players. - 此次促销活动在农历新年（中国人民最重要的年度节日）前几周举行，预计将为苹果公司带来更多收入，以应对来自本土竞争对手日益激烈的竞争。

    句子分析：这是一个长句，主句是The sale is expected to boost revenue for Apple，其中主语是The sale，谓语是is expected to boost revenue for Apple，宾语是revenue for Apple。coming several weeks ahead of the Lunar New Year, the most important annual festival for Chinese people是一个现在分词短语作定语，修饰The sale，表示此次促销活动在农历新年（中国人民最重要的年度节日）前几周举行。amid increasing competition from local players是一个介词短语作状语，表示在来自本土竞争对手日益激烈的竞争中。这个句子的意思是说，此次促销活动在农历新年（中国人民最重要的年度节日）前几周举行，预计将为苹果公司带来更多收入，以应对来自本土竞争对手日益激烈的竞争。

语法：

  • 名词性从句 - 用于修饰先行词名词或代词。

    原文例句：The firm’s mainland China website said consumers can receive up to 500 yuan off from the 13 model up to the latest 15 version, while the subsidy for MacBook Air is up to 800 yuan.

    语法讲解：这种从句以that, which, whose, who, whom等连接词来引导，也可以不用连接词，直接在从句中使用名词，这种情况下，从句被称作同位语从句或限制性定语从句。在这个例句中，名词性从句是from the 13 model up to the latest 15 version和while the subsidy for MacBook Air is up to 800 yuan，分别修饰先行词model和subsidy。

  • 比较级和最高级 - 用于比较两个或多个事物或情况的差异程度。

    原文例句：The sale is coming several weeks ahead of the Lunar New Year, the most important annual festival for Chinese people.

    语法讲解：比较级和最高级是对形容词或副词的变形，以比较事物或情况之间的差异。比较级通常在词尾加-er，最高级在词尾加-est。在这个例句中，比较级是more important，最高级是the most important，表示农历新年是中国人民最重要的年度节日。

  • Consumers can receive up to 500 yuan off from the 13 model up to the latest 15 version, while the subsidy for MacBook Air is up to 800 yuan
  • Apple has been facing mounting competitive pressure from Chinese rivals, especially Huawei, as they inch towards the premium smartphone segment

US consumer electronics giant Apple is offering Chinese consumers discounts of up to 800 yuan (US$113) on a range of products, from iPhones to MacBooks, in a move to fend off intensifying competition from local rivals such as Huawei Technologies ahead of the Lunar New Year.

In a sales promotion covering iPhones, iPads, MacBook Air laptops, the Apple Watch and AirPods, which will run until the end of the coming weekend, consumers can receive up to 500 yuan off from the 13 model up to the latest 15 version, while the subsidy for MacBook Air is up to 800 yuan, according to the firm’s mainland China website.

The sale, coming several weeks ahead of the Lunar New Year, the most important annual festival for Chinese people, is expected to boost revenue for Apple amid increasing competition from local players, according to Ivan Lam, senior analyst at market consultancy Counterpoint Research.

Apple to launch classical music app in China amid weak iPhone sales

Lam said the timing of Apple’s price cuts in China would take advantage of the typical consumer spending surge around the Lunar New Year.

“The strategic price adjustment will cancel out competitive pressure but will also boost sales growth, especially around the Lunar New Year season,” Lam said in a research note on Monday, adding that the move will also help Apple clear out older models from its inventory.

Apple has been facing mounting competitive pressure from Chinese rivals, especially Huawei, as they inch towards the premium smartphone segment once ruled over by the Cupertino, California-based company, according to Lam.

Chinese smartphone brands have rolled out a series of middle to high-end devices over the last few months, many of which are competitively priced from 3,999 yuan, and equipped with functions that rival higher-priced phones, he noted.

Foxconn pushes into car production near its biggest iPhone plant

These models, representing efforts made by Chinese vendors to vie for the premium smartphone segment, are posing challenges to Apple’s older iPhone models as well as the basic versions of its new iPhone 15 line.

Total 2023 sales volume for the iPhone in mainland China dropped 3 per cent year on year, which translated to a 0.4 per cent decline in Apple’s market share, according to equity research firm Jefferies.

Jefferies estimated that Huawei saw its mainland market share in the December quarter gain 2 per cent from the previous quarter, and 6 per cent year on year.

item.title: Internet titans bury the hatchet as Tencent allows Douyin to air Honour of Kings videos amid ByteDance retreat
item.description:
Summary：

字节跳动和腾讯就短视频和游戏业务达成了和解。字节跳动将退出游戏业务，将旗下游戏业务出售给腾讯。腾讯的《王者荣耀》将重回字节跳动的短视频平台抖音。这场持续多年的纷争终于告一段落。
  • Abstract: Bytedance withdraws from game business and reconciles with Tencent.
  • Theme: The two tech giants end their years-long disputes.
  • Viewpoint: The regulatory uncertainties and weaker macro environment in China contribute to this reconciliation.
  • Main information: Bytedance's game operations will be sold to Tencent; "Honor of Kings" will return to Douyin; the two companies signed a content distribution agreement.

总结：

字节跳动和腾讯就短视频和游戏业务的纠纷达成和解，字节跳动将退出游戏业务，将旗下游戏业务出售给腾讯，腾讯的《王者荣耀》将重回字节跳动的短视频平台抖音。这场持续多年的纷争终于告一段落。
  • 摘要：字节跳动退出游戏业务，与腾讯冰释前嫌。
  • 主题：两大科技巨头结束多年纷争。
  • 观点：中国监管的不确定性和宏观经济环境疲软促成此次和解。
  • 主要信息：字节跳动游戏业务将出售给腾讯；《王者荣耀》将重返抖音；两家公司签署内容分发协议。

单词 :

  • plagiarize (v.) - /ˈpleɪdʒəraɪz/ 抄袭。

    原文例句：Zhang accused Tencent of plagiarising Douyin and Ma fired back, calling the comment “slander”.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Latin，由plagiarius（绑架者，抄袭者）和-ize（使……成为）构成，意为“抄袭”。在这个例句中，它描述了张一鸣指责腾讯抄袭抖音，而马化腾则反驳说这一评论是“诽谤”。

  • slander (n.) - /ˈslændər/ 诽谤，中伤。

    原文例句：Zhang accused Tencent of plagiarising Douyin and Ma fired back, calling the comment “slander”.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Old English，由sland（耻辱，可耻）和-er（表示人或物）构成，意为“诽谤，中伤”。在这个例句中，它描述了马化腾认为张一鸣指责腾讯抄袭抖音的评论是“诽谤”。

词组：

  • for its part - 就其而言，就其来说。

    原文例句：For its part, TikTok owner ByteDance has also confirmed it is in talks with multiple potential buyers, including Tencent, for its video game operations.

    例句讲解：这个词组由for（关于，为了）和its part（它的部分，它的方面）构成，表示“就其而言，就其来说”。在这个例句中，它表示TikTok所有者字节跳动已经证实正在与包括腾讯在内的多个潜在买家讨论出售其视频游戏业务。

句子：

  • The Shenzhen-based social media and gaming giant and Beijing-based ByteDance have fought years of bidding wars over Chinese video game studios and court battles over copyright, but that has ceased with Tencent now seen as a potential buyer of ByteDance’s gaming operations. - 深圳的社交媒体和游戏巨头与北京的字节跳动多年来一直就中国的视频游戏工作室进行竞标战，并在版权问题上进行法庭斗争，但现在随着腾讯被视为字节跳动游戏业务的潜在买家，这种斗争已经停止。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是ByteDance’s gaming operations has ceased，其中主语是ByteDance’s gaming operations，谓语是has ceased。The Shenzhen-based social media and gaming giant and Beijing-based ByteDance have fought years of bidding wars over Chinese video game studios and court battles over copyright是一个过去完成时态的句子，其中主语是The Shenzhen-based social media and gaming giant and Beijing-based ByteDance，谓语是have fought，宾语是years of bidding wars，介词短语over Chinese video game studios和介词短语over copyright是两个状语，分别表示竞标战的主题和法庭斗争的主题。but that has ceased with Tencent now seen as a potential buyer of ByteDance’s gaming operations是一个现在完成时态的句子，其中主语是that，谓语是has ceased，状语with Tencent now seen as a potential buyer of ByteDance’s gaming operations表示腾讯现在被视为字节跳动游戏业务的潜在买家。这个句子的意思是说，深圳的社交媒体和游戏巨头与北京的字节跳动多年来一直就中国的视频游戏工作室进行竞标战，并在版权问题上进行法庭斗争，但现在随着腾讯被视为字节跳动游戏业务的潜在买家，这种斗争已经停止。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Tencent’s eight-year-old Honour of Kings, however, continues to lead as the world’s highest-grossing mobile game in November, according to data from Sensor Tower.

    语法讲解：这是一种时态，结构是：have/has + been + 现在分词。其中have/has要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，been是be的过去分词，现在分词是动词的-ing形式。这种时态表示动作或状态从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在，强调动作或状态的持续性和未完成性。在这个例句中，它表示腾讯的八岁游戏《王者荣耀》在十一月份仍然是全球收入最高的移动游戏。

  • 过去完成时 - 表示在过去的某个时间点之前已经完成的动作或状态。

    原文例句：More legal battles followed in the next few years, as ByteDance accused Tencent of blocking links to Douyin in its flagship WeChat app.

    语法讲解：这是一种时态，结构是：had + been + 过去分词。其中had要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，been是be的过去分词，过去分词是动词的-ed形式或不规则过去分词。这种时态表示在过去的某个时间点之前已经完成的动作或状态，强调动作或状态的完成性。在这个例句中，它表示在接下来的几年里，字节跳动指责腾讯在其旗舰微信应用程序中屏蔽了对抖音的链接，更多的法律斗争随之而来。

  • Shenzhen-based social media and gaming giant and Beijing-based ByteDance have fought years of bidding wars over Chinese studios
  • ByteDance’s retreat from the mainstay of Tencent’s business is likely to bring the curtain down on a series of online spats

Honour of Kings, the blockbuster video game from market leader Tencent Holdings, will return to ByteDance’s short video app Douyin as the two internet giants bury the hatchet following the TikTok owner’s decision to exit the sector.

The Shenzhen-based social media and gaming giant and Beijing-based ByteDance have fought years of bidding wars over Chinese video game studios and court battles over copyright, but that has ceased with Tencent now seen as a potential buyer of ByteDance’s gaming operations.

Honour of Kings, the world’s most popular mobile game, will be officially streamed on Douyin’s live-streaming platform from January 21, according to an announcement by the title’s official account on social media platform Weibo.

Before the official return, live-streaming sessions featuring Chinese esports team XYG began on Douyin on Sunday, and another three-day session with Zhang Daxian, a popular Honour of Kings streamer with over 50 million followers on the video platform, is slated to start on Thursday.

The game’s return to the ByteDance platform comes five years after a court in Guangzhou, capital of southern Guangdong province, banned the streaming of Honour of Kings on Xigua Video, another video streaming site run by the Douyin operator, in 2019.

The collaboration between ByteDance’s popular Chinese video app and Tencent’s biggest title comes amid regulatory uncertainties for the industry and a weaker macro environment in China. Tencent’s eight-year-old Honour of Kings, however, continues to lead as the world’s highest-grossing mobile game in November, according to data from Sensor Tower.

TikTok owner ByteDance has also confirmed it is in talks with multiple potential buyers, including Tencent, for its video game operations.

The retreat by ByteDance from the mainstay of Tencent’s business is likely to bring the curtain down on a series of online spats between the two billionaire founders of the respective companies, which saw a freeze in business dealings and dozens of lawsuits between them.

The feud started in 2018 with the rapid rise of Douyin, the Chinese sister app of TikTok, when Tencent boss Pony Ma Huateng and ByteDance founder Zhang Yiming engaged in rare online bickering. Zhang accused Tencent of plagiarising Douyin and Ma fired back, calling the comment “slander”.

ByteDance later sued the Shenzhen-based tech giant for anticompetitive behaviour and Tencent responded with a defamation lawsuit. Tencent also announced that it would halt all existing partnerships with ByteDance and its affiliated companies.

More legal battles followed in the next few years, as ByteDance accused Tencent of blocking links to Douyin in its flagship WeChat app. Tencent sued ByteDance for copyright infringement by streaming video and gaming content without authorisation.

However, there has been a growing thaw in icy relations in recent years.

In 2023 Tencent and Douyin ended their copyright disputes by signing a cooperation agreement on content distribution. Under the deal, Tencent will authorise Douyin to distribute its video content and it clarified copyright rules for users to produce modifications and adaptations.

Users of Douyin, Xigua Video and Jinri Toutiao, all operated by ByteDance, will also be able to produce derivative works based on Tencent-owned videos.

item.title: China EVs: CATL, world’s top battery maker, plans first plant in Beijing to supply Li Auto and Xiaomi
item.description:
Summary：

CATL, the world's largest EV battery manufacturer, plans to build its first plant in Beijing to meet the growing demand of battery-powered cars in China. This plant will help Beijing's auto-industry supply chain, especially for Li Auto and Xiaomi who are both based in Beijing.
  • Abstract: CATL to build its first plant in Beijing to tap the rising demand for battery-powered cars in mainland China.
  • Theme: Beijing's automotive industry supply chain to be strengthened with CATL's new plant.
  • Viewpoint: CATL's strategic move to establish a local production base to serve major clients in Beijing, including Li Auto and Xiaomi.
  • Main information: CATL's dominant position in the global battery market; Beijing's EV market potential; Li Auto's and Xiaomi's EV development; Shenxing battery's fast-charging capability.

总结：

宁德时代，全球最大的电动汽车电池制造商，计划在北京建造其第一家工厂，以满足中国大陆对电池动力汽车不断增长的需求。这家工厂将帮助北京的汽车工业供应链，特别是对于总部位于北京的理想汽车和小米汽车。
  • 摘要：宁德时代将在北京建设首家工厂，以满足中国大陆对电池动力汽车不断增长的需求。
  • 主题：北京的汽车工业供应链将随着宁德时代新工厂的建立而得到加强。
  • 观点：宁德时代在北京建立当地生产基地以服务主要客户（包括理想汽车和小米汽车）的战略举措。
  • 主要信息：宁德时代在全球电池市场的主导地位；北京电动汽车市场的潜力；理想汽车和小米汽车的电动汽车发展；神行电池的快速充电能力。

单词：

  • gigawatt-hour (n.) 千瓦时，千瓦小时。

    原文例句：The company, which had a 37.4 per cent share of the global market with an output of 233.4 gigawatt-hours of batteries in the first 11 months of 2023, is set to become a key vendor to Li Auto and Xiaomi when the smartphone maker’s Beijing plant becomes operational, according to analysts.

    例句讲解：千瓦时这个词由千瓦和小时构成，表示一千瓦的功率持续一小时所消耗的能量。在这个例句中，it refers to the amount of electricity that a battery can store and deliver。千瓦时是衡量电池容量的常用单位。

  • penetration (n.) 渗透，穿透。

    原文例句：In China, the EV penetration rate exceeded 40 per cent in late 2023 amid motorists’ rising penchant for environmentally friendly cars featuring autonomous driving technology and digital cockpits.

    例句讲解：渗透这个词源于拉丁语 penetrare，表示“刺穿，穿透”。在这个例句中，it refers to the extent to which electric vehicles have become popular and widespread in China。渗透率是一个衡量市场份额或市场占有率的指标。

词组：

  • tap into - 利用，开发。

    原文例句：Contemporary Amperex Technology (CATL), the world’s largest electric vehicle (EV) battery manufacturer, will build its first plant in Beijing to tap the rising demand for battery-powered cars in mainland China.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由tap（敲击，轻击）和into（进入，渗透）组成的，表示“利用，开发”。在这个例句中，it means to take advantage of the growing demand for battery-powered cars in mainland China。利用是寻找和利用机会或资源的行为。

句子：

  • The company, which had a 37.4 per cent share of the global market with an output of 233.4 gigawatt-hours of batteries in the first 11 months of 2023, is set to become a key vendor to Li Auto and Xiaomi when the smartphone maker’s Beijing plant becomes operational, according to analysts. - 该公司在 2023 年头 11 个月以 233.4 千兆瓦时的产量占据全球市场 37.4% 的份额，据分析师称，当这家智能手机制造商的北京工厂开始运营时，它将成为理想汽车和小米的关键供应商。

    句子分析：这是一个复杂句，主句是The company is set to become a key vendor to Li Auto and Xiaomi，其中主语是The company，谓语是is set to become，宾语是a key vendor to Li Auto and Xiaomi。which had a 37.4 per cent share of the global market with an output of 233.4 gigawatt-hours of batteries in the first 11 months of 2023是一个定语从句，修饰主语The company，表示该公司在2023年头11个月以233.4千兆瓦时的产量占据全球市场37.4%的份额。when the smartphone maker’s Beijing plant becomes operational是一个时间状语从句，表示当这家智能手机制造商的北京工厂开始运营时。这个句子的意思是说，该公司在2023年头11个月以233.4千兆瓦时的产量占据全球市场37.4%的份额，据分析师称，当这家智能手机制造商的北京工厂开始运营时，它将成为理想汽车和小米的关键供应商。

语法：

  • 现在进行时 - 表示正在进行的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Sales of battery-powered vehicles on the mainland are expected to slow to 20 per cent this year, compared with 37 per cent growth recorded in 2023, according to a forecast by Fitch Ratings in November.

    语法讲解：这是一个常见的时态，结构是：be + 现在分词。其中be要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，现在分词是动词的-ing形式。这种时态表示动作或状态正在进行或发生。在这个例句中，it indicates that the sales of battery-powered vehicles on the mainland are currently slowing down。现在进行时也可以表示未来将要发生的动作或状态，但需要在句中加入时间状语来表示。

  • CATL, which had a 37.4 per cent share of the global battery market last year, will start construction on the Beijing plant this year, city’s economic planner says
  • Ningde-based firm plans to deliver its Shenxing battery, which can offer 400km of driving range with just 10 minutes of charging, before the end of the first quarter

Contemporary Amperex Technology (CATL), the world’s largest electric vehicle (EV) battery manufacturer, will build its first plant in Beijing to tap the rising demand for battery-powered cars in mainland China.

CATL’s plant will help China’s capital city form a complete supply-chain for EV production, as Li Auto, the country’s top electric-car start-up, and smartphone maker Xiaomi, both based in Beijing, step up the development of new models.

CATL, based in Ningde, eastern Fujian province, will begin construction on the plant this year, according to a statement by the Beijing Commission of Development and Reform, the city’s economic planning agency, which did not provide details about the plant’s capacity or launch date. CATL declined to comment.

The company, which had a 37.4 per cent share of the global market with an output of 233.4 gigawatt-hours of batteries in the first 11 months of 2023, is set to become a key vendor to Li Auto and Xiaomi when the smartphone maker’s Beijing plant becomes operational, according to analysts.

Li Auto is already a major player in China’s premium EV segment, and Xiaomi has the potential to become one, said Cao Hua, a partner at private-equity firm Unity Asset Management.

“So it is reasonable for key suppliers like CATL to establish local production lines to serve its major clients,” Cao said.

Beijing’s economic planning agency said that Li Auto is considering setting up a production base for car parts, without revealing details.

Li Auto is the closest rival to Tesla in China’s premium EV segment, delivering 376,030 intelligent vehicles to mainland buyers in 2023, a jump of 182.2 per cent year on year.

Tesla handed 603,664 units made at its Shanghai Gigafactory to Chinese customers last year, an increase of 37.3 per cent year on year.

Xiaomi unveiled its first model, SU7, at the end of 2023. Featuring a sleek look and a sports-car level of performance, the company plans to begin trial production of the electric sedan in the coming months.

CEO Lei Jun said Xiaomi will strive to become a top five global carmaker in the next 15 to 20 years.

In China, the EV penetration rate exceeded 40 per cent in late 2023 amid motorists’ rising penchant for environmentally friendly cars featuring autonomous driving technology and digital cockpits.

Mainland China is now the world’s largest automotive and EV market, with sales of battery-powered cars accounting for about 60 per cent of the global total.

UBS analyst Paul Gong said last week that only 10 to 12 companies would survive the cutthroat mainland market by 2030, as intensifying competition has been piling pressure on the 200-plus Chinese EV makers.

Sales of battery-powered vehicles on the mainland are expected to slow to 20 per cent this year, compared with 37 per cent growth recorded in 2023, according to a forecast by Fitch Ratings in November.

Meanwhile, CATL will start delivering the world’s fastest-charging electric-car battery before the end of the year’s first quarter, another technological breakthrough to speed up the use of battery-powered cars.

The Shenxing battery, which can offer 400 kilometres of driving range with just 10 minutes of charging and reach 100 per cent capacity in just 15 minutes as a result of the so-called 4C charging capabilities.

item.title: Why a Chinese court’s landmark decision recognising the copyright for an AI-generated image benefits creators in this nascent field
item.description:
Summary：

北京互联网法院法官朱葛表示，赋予生成式人工智能内容法律地位旨在鼓励人们使用新工具进行创作。法院去年 11 月的裁决为关于 AI 生成的内容是否应受版权法保护的激烈争论火上浇油。北京互联网法院去年 11 月裁定，一张人工智能生成的照片是一件艺术作品，其依据是创作者的提示和重复调整如何产生反映其“审美选择和个性化判断”的图片。插图：快门库存照片
  • Abstract: Assigning legal status to generative AI content aims to promote creation using new tools.
  • Theme: A Beijing Internet Court ruling recognizes the copyright of an AI-generated image, sparking discussions on protecting AI-generated content.
  • Viewpoint: The ruling encourages creativity with new tools and emphasizes the need to assess future disputes on a case-by-case basis.
  • Main information: The ruling considers the originality and intellectual input of the human creator in determining the copyright of AI-generated images. The case involved an AI-generated image of an Asian woman, leading to an intellectual property dispute and a subsequent lawsuit.

总结：

北京互联网法院法官朱葛表示，赋予生成式人工智能内容法律地位旨在鼓励人们使用新工具进行创作。法院去年11月的裁决为关于人工智能生成的内容是否应受版权法保护的激烈争论火上浇油。北京互联网法院去年11月裁定，一张人工智能生成的照片是一件艺术作品，其依据是创作者的提示和重复调整如何产生反映其“审美选择和个性化判断”的图片。插图：快门库存照片
  • 摘要：赋予生成式人工智能内容法律地位旨在促进使用新工具进行创作。
  • 主题：北京互联网法院的裁决认可了人工智能生成图像的版权，引发了关于保护人工智能生成内容的讨论。
  • 观点：该裁决鼓励使用新工具进行创作，并强调需要根据具体情况对未来的争议进行评估。
  • 主要信息：该裁决认为，人类创作者的原创性和智力投入决定了人工智能生成图像的版权。此案涉及一张人工智能生成亚洲女性图片，引发了知识产权纠纷和随后的诉讼。

单词：

  • adjudicated (v.) - /əˈdʒuːdɪkeɪt/ 裁决，审判。

    原文例句：The intellectual property infringement lawsuit was initiated in May last year by the plaintiff surnamed Li, who used the US start-up StabilityAI’s Stable Diffusion program to create an image of a young Asian woman and posted it on Chinese social media platform Xiaohongshu.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于拉丁语ad（向…）和iudicare（判断），意为“判决，审判”。在这个例句中，它表示去年5月，原告李某对知识产权侵权提起诉讼，他使用美国初创公司StabilityAI的Stable Diffusion程序创建了一个年轻的亚洲女性图像，并将其发布在中国的社交媒体平台小红书上。

  • emerging (adj.) - /ɪˈmɜːdʒɪŋ/ 新兴的，出现的。

    原文例句：Zhu, the presiding judge, said in her lecture that the ruling was made with the potential implications for “emerging industries” in mind, according to The Paper’s report.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于拉丁语emergere（出现），意为“新兴的，出现的”。在这个例句中，它表示主审法官朱葛在她的演讲中表示，在做出裁决时考虑了对“新兴产业”的潜在影响，据《纸报》报道。

词组：

  • case-by-case basis - 个案基础，逐案处理。

    原文例句：Although the ruling has added fuel to heated arguments on whether AI-generated content should be protected by copyright laws, the Beijing Internet Court has asserted that future disputes about an author’s personal expression in images created with AI’s help should be judged on a case-by-case basis.

    例句讲解：这个词组表示“个案基础，逐案处理”。它强调需要根据每起案件的具体情况进行判断，而不是简单地套用法律或规则。在这个例句中，它表示尽管该裁决使关于AI生成内容是否应受版权法保护的激烈争论火上浇油，但北京互联网法院断言，未来关于作者在AI帮助下创作的图像中的个人表达的争议应根据具体情况逐案进行判断。

  • intellectual property infringement - 知识产权侵权。

    原文例句：The intellectual property infringement lawsuit was initiated in May last year by the plaintiff surnamed Li.

    例句讲解：这个词组由intellectual property（知识产权）和infringement（侵权）组成，表示“侵犯知识产权”。知识产权是指自然人、法人或其他组织依法享有的专利权、商标权、版权等权利。在这个例句中，它表示去年5月，原告李某对知识产权侵权提起诉讼。

    句子分析：这是一个主谓宾句，主语是Beijing court，谓语是rules，宾语是AI-generated content covered by copyright。Beijing court rules表示“北京法院裁定”，AI-generated content covered by copyright表示“人工智能生成的内容受版权保护”。eschews US stand是一个分词短语，作状语，表示“回避美国立场”。这个句子的意思是说，北京法院裁定人工智能生成的内容受版权保护，回避了美国立场。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示过去某个时间完成的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Assigning generative AI content a legal status under certain conditions in this case is aimed at encouraging people to create with new tools, presiding judge Zhu Ge said last week at a lecture that was first reported on Monday by Chinese online news outlet The Paper.

    语法讲解：现在完成时表示过去某个时间完成的动作或状态，强调动作或状态的结果或影响延续到现在。结构是：have/has + been + 过去分词。其中have/has要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，been是be的过去分词，过去分词是动词的-ed形式或不规则变化形式。在这个例句中，Assigning generative AI content a legal status under certain conditions in this case is aimed at encouraging people to create with new tools是一个现在完成时，表示过去某个时间完成的动作或状态，强调动作或状态的结果或影响延续到现在，即赋予生成式人工智能内容法律地位的目的是鼓励人们使用新工具进行创作。

  • 反
    • Assigning generative AI content a legal status aims to encourage people to create with new tools, Beijing Internet Court judge Zhu Ge said
    • The court’s ruling last November has added fuel to heated arguments on whether AI-generated content should be protected by copyright laws

    A Chinese court’s decision recognising the copyright of an image generated via artificial intelligence (AI) aims to encourage such creations and provide a boost to this nascent industry, according to the judge who made the landmark ruling.

    In the first judgment of its kind in mainland China, the Beijing Internet Court last November ruled that a picture, generated via the text-to-image software Stable Diffusion, should be considered an artwork under the protection of copyright laws, because of the “originality” and intellectual input of its human creator.

    Assigning generative AI content a legal status under certain conditions in this case is aimed at encouraging people to create with new tools, presiding judge Zhu Ge said last week at a lecture that was first reported on Monday by Chinese online news outlet The Paper.

    “If no content created with AI models can be considered artwork, this would deal a blow to the industry,” Zhu was quoted as saying in the report.

    Although the ruling has added fuel to heated arguments on whether AI-generated content should be protected by copyright laws, the Beijing Internet Court has asserted that future disputes about an author’s personal expression in images created with AI’s help should be judged on a case-by-case basis.

    The intellectual property infringement lawsuit was initiated in May last year by the plaintiff surnamed Li, who used the US start-up StabilityAI’s Stable Diffusion program to create an image of a young Asian woman and posted it on Chinese social media platform Xiaohongshu.

    Li sued a blogger surnamed Liu for allegedly using that image without permission in a post on Baijiahao, a Chinese content-sharing platform owned by Baidu.

    The court subsequently ruled in favour of Li. It said Li’s AI-generated image was an artwork, based on how he had continuously added prompts and repeatedly adjusted the parameters to come up with a picture that reflected his “aesthetic choice and personalised judgment”.

    Beijing court rules AI-generated content covered by copyright, eschews US stand

    The court ordered the defendant Liu to issue a public apology as well as pay the plaintiff 500 yuan (US$70.43) in damages and 50 yuan for court fees.

    Zhu, the presiding judge, said in her lecture that the ruling was made with the potential implications for “emerging industries” in mind, according to The Paper’s report. It said Zhu hoped her decision in the case could serve as a reference for future disputes.

    The court’s ruling has come as China’s aspirations for generative AI continue to evolve amid wider use of the technology around the world. Advances in the use of AI are also expected to transform industries and improve people’s daily lives.

    China’s generative AI industry is forecast to contribute 30 trillion yuan worth of economic value by 2035, accounting for a third of the industry’s global value of 90 trillion yuan, according to a report by the CCID Group, a research unit affiliated with Ministry of Industry and Information Technology.

    Many Chinese tech firms have also ramped up their efforts to grow their businesses using generative AI. Chinese delivery services giant Meituan, for example, recently launched Wow, a chatbot that purports to respond to user questions with a personal touch.

    Alibaba Group Holding, owner of the South China Morning Post, featured an online shop for digital products based on Baidu’s virtual assistant Duxiaoxiao during the e-commerce giant’s Singles’ Day campaign last year.
